recipes.title: Lentil Bolognese
ingredients: 1 cup brown or green lentils, rinsed and drained
directions: Saute the onion, garlic, carrots, and celery in olive oil until the vegetables are tender.
Add the lentils, crushed tomatoes, vegetable broth, basil, oregano, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until the lentils are tender.
Season with red wine and nutritional yeast if using.
Serve over pasta.

recipes.title: Farmer’s Market Vegetarian Enchiladas
ingredients: 1 cup roasted vegetables (such as zucchini, bell peppers, onions)
1 cup shredded cheese (Monterey Jack or Cheddar)
Optional toppings: sour cream, avocado, salsa
directions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Fill tortillas with black beans and roasted vegetables.
Roll the tortillas and place them in a baking dish. Cover with enchilada sauce and cheese.
Bake until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Garnish with cilantro and add desired toppings.

recipes.title: Butternut Squash Risotto
ingredients: 1 medium butternut squash, peeled and cubed
directions: Roast the butternut squash in the oven until tender.
Saute the onion and garlic in olive oil until softened.
Add the Arborio rice and cook until lightly toasted.
Add white wine (if using) and cook until absorbed.
Gradually add warmed broth, stirring continuously until the rice is cooked.
Stir in roasted squash, butter, and Parmesan cheese.
Garnish with sage and maple pecans if desired.

recipes.title: Indian Shepherd’s Pie
ingredients: 1 cup brown or green lentils, rinsed and drained
2 cups mixed vegetables (such as carrots, peas, corn)
directions: Cook the lentils and mixed vegetables in a flavorful broth with onion, garlic, Garam Masala, and curry powder.
Boil the potatoes until tender, then mash with butter or ghee.
Transfer the lentil mixture to a baking dish and top with mashed potatoes.
Bake in the oven until the potatoes are golden brown.

recipes.title: Moroccan Cauliflower Bowls
ingredients: 1 head of cauliflower, broken into florets
Chopped almonds, pomegranate seeds, and fresh spinach for garnish
directions: Roast the cauliflower in the oven with olive oil, onion, and garlic until tender.
Cook the Moroccan rice according to package instructions.
Mix the roasted cauliflower with chickpeas, cumin, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper.
Serve over Moroccan rice and garnish with almonds, pomegranate seeds, and spinach.

recipes.title: Butternut Squash Lasagna
ingredients: 1 medium butternut squash, peeled and cubed
directions: Roast the butternut squash in the oven until tender.
Saute the onion and garlic in olive oil until softened.
Cook the lasagna noodles according to package instructions.
Layer the lasagna with marinara sauce, roasted squash, ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese, and Parmesan cheese.
Bake in the oven until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Garnish with sage.

recipes.title: Eggplant Parmesan
ingredients: 2 medium eggplants, sliced into 1/4-inch thick rounds
directions: Bread the eggplant slices with flour, breadcrumbs, and Parmesan cheese.
Bake the eggplant slices in the oven until golden brown.
Layer the eggplant slices with marinara sauce and mozzarella cheese in a baking dish.
Bake in the oven until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Garnish with basil.

recipes.title: Miso Pasta
ingredients: 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese (or vegan alternative)
directions: Cook the pasta according to package instructions.
Whisk together miso paste and butter until smooth.
Saute the garlic and mushrooms in a pan until the mushrooms are tender.
Combine the cooked pasta, miso mixture, and mushroom mixture.
Top with Parmesan cheese and parsley.

recipes.title: Baked Ziti
directions: Cook the ziti pasta according to package instructions.
Mix the ricotta cheese with spinach and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Layer the ziti pasta, marinara sauce, ricotta mixture, mozzarella cheese, and Parmesan cheese in a baking dish.
Bake in the oven until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

recipes.title: Easy to Make Pad Thai
ingredients: 3 tablespoons oil (peanut oil, avocado oil, or coconut oil)
8 ounces protein (chicken breast, tofu, or prawns - peeled and deveined)
2 eggs, whisked with a generous 3-finger pinch of salt (or no salt for vegan option)
3 tablespoons fish sauce (or vegan fish sauce)
3 tablespoons brown sugar (or coconut sugar, palm sugar, or regular sugar)
directions: Pour boiling water over the rice noodles and let them soak until they are soft and pliable (about 5-6 minutes), but not overly soft. Drain and rinse with cold water to stop cooking.
Whisk the eggs in a medium bowl with a pinch of salt. Set aside by the stove.
Whisk the fish sauce, rice vinegar, brown sugar, and soy sauce together in a small bowl. Ensure the sugar completely dissolves. Set aside.
Slice chicken into very thin strips and season with salt and pepper. For crispy tofu, pat dry extra firm tofu with paper towels to release moisture, then cut into strips or cubes.

Heat a little oil in the wok over medium heat. Add the shallot and garlic and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes. Scoot the shallot mixture to the side, add more oil, and pour in the eggs. Scramble and break them apart into little bits, then move them to the side.
Add more oil, then the noodles, and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until the noodles are soft and pliable and slightly crispy. Add the protein (chicken, tofu, or prawns) and stir-fry until cooked through.
Pour in the Pad Thai Sauce and stir-fry everything together.
Add the bean sprouts and stir-fry for another minute.
Serve immediately, garnishing with lime wedges, additional bean sprouts, and any desired toppings like peanuts or chili flakes.
